page.title: 10SYNAGOGUE-N.LEEDS
page.content: CENTRAL VILNA SYNAGOGUE-is on Harrogate Road it is within this area that the majority of the Leeds Jewish community of 14000 people reside.The synagogue seats 600 people. Before 1959, the building was used as a cinema, then it became a place of worship.Rabbi Angyalfi also preaches at the synagogue on Street Lane.Another synagogue is being built in Alwoodley.It will seat 1100 people. There is a home for 200 elderly Jewish people, half of whom are in the hospital department.There is a staff of 200, a quarter of whom are voluntary. State education is provided for 400 Jewish children in the Brodetsky Primary and Morris Silman Middle schools in Alwoodley.There is also a private nursery department.
